title: Harry Potter
description: Series of seven fantasy novels written by British author J. K. Rowling. The main story arc concerns Harry's struggle against Lord Voldemort, a dark wizard who intends to become immortal, overthrow the wizard governing body known as the Ministry of Magic and subjugate all wizards and Muggles.

title: Avatar
description: Epic science fiction film directed by James Cameron. During its theatrical run, the film broke several box office records and became the highest-grossing film at the time.

title: The Lion King
description: The Lion King tells the story of Simba, a young lion who is to succeed his father, Mufasa, as King of the Pride Lands; however, after Simba's paternal uncle Scar murders Mufasa to seize the throne, Simba is manipulated into thinking he was responsible and flees into exile.

title: Jurassic Park
description: American science fiction media franchise centered on a disastrous attempt to create a theme park of cloned dinosaurs.

title: Titanic
description: American epic romance and disaster film. Incorporating both historical and fictionalized aspects, it is based on accounts of the sinking of the RMS Titanic.

title: Star Wars
description: American epic space opera film. Set

in a fictional universe where the galaxy is ruled by the tyrannical Galactic Empire, the story focuses on a group of freedom fighters known as the Rebel Alliance, who aim to destroy the Empire's newest weapon, the Death Star.

title: Frozen
description: Let it go!

title: Game of Thrones
description: American fantasy drama television series. It is an adaptation of A Song of Ice and Fire, a series of fantasy novels by George R. R. Martin, the first of which is A Game of Thrones.

title: Friends
description: American television sitcom, which revolves around six friends in their 20s and 30s who live in Manhattan, New York City.

title: Squid Game
description: South Korean survival drama television series created by Hwang Dong-hyuk for Netflix, currently the service's most-watched series at its launch.

title: Jaws
description: American thriller film directed by Steven Spielberg. In the film, a man-eating great white shark attacks beachgoers at a summer resort town, prompting police chief Martin Brody to hunt it with the help of a marine biologist and a professional shark hunter.

title: Inception
description: Science fiction action film written and directed by Christopher Nolan. The film stars Leonardo DiCaprio as a professional thief who steals information by infiltrating the subconscious of his targets.

title: Money Heist
description: Spanish heist crime drama television series created by Álex Pina. The series traces two long-prepared heists led by the Professor, one on the Royal Mint of Spain, and one on the Bank of Spain, told from the perspective of one of the robbers.

title: Stranger Things
description: American science fiction horror drama television. Set in the 1980s in the fictional town of Hawkins, Indiana, the series initially focuses on the investigation into the disappearance of a young boy amid supernatural events occurring around the town.

title: Black Mirror
description: British anthology television series created by Charlie Brooker. Individual episodes explore a diversity of genres, but most are set in near-future dystopias utilising a science fiction technology.

title: Singin' in the Rain
description: 1952 American musical romantic comedy film. It offers a lighthearted depiction of Hollywood in the late 1920s, with the three stars portraying performers caught up in the transition from silent films to

title: Supernatural
description: American dark fantasy drama television series. The series follows the two brothers as they hunt demons, ghosts, monsters, and other supernatural beings.

title: Get Out
description: 2017 American horror film. The plot follows a young black man, who uncovers shocking secrets when he meets the family of his white girlfriend.

title: Inside Out
description: American computer-animated film. The film follows five personified emotions: Joy, Sadness, Fear, Anger, and Disgust. Inside the mind, they lead a young girl named Riley through life as she and her parents adjust to their new surroundings after moving from Minnesota to San Francisco.

title: Moana
description: 2016 American computer-animated musical adventure film. It tells the story of Moana, the strong-willed daughter of a chief of a Polynesian village.

title: Coco
description: 2017 American computer-animated fantasy film. The story follows a 12-year-old boy named Miguel who is accidentally transported to the Land of the Dead, where he seeks the help of his deceased musician great-great-grandfather to return him to his family among the living and to reverse his family's ban on music.

title: Twilight
description: 2008 American romantic fantasy film based on Stephenie Meyer's 2005 novel of the same name. This film focuses on the development of the relationship between Bella Swan and Edward Cullen.

title: Pulp Fiction
description: 1994 American black comedy crime film. It tells several stories of crime in Los Angeles. The title refers to the pulp magazines and hardboiled crime novels popular during the mid-20th century, known for their graphic violence and punchy dialogue.

title: Clockwork Orange
description: 1971 dystopian crime film. It employs disturbing, violent images to comment on psychiatry, juvenile delinquency, youth gangs, and other social, political, and economic subjects in a dystopian near-future Britain.

title: American Beauty
description: 1999 American psychological black comedy-drama film. Kevin Spacey stars as Lester Burnham, an advertising executive who has a midlife crisis when he becomes infatuated with his teenage daughter's best friend.

title: Whiplash
description: 2014 American psychological drama film. The story follows ambitious jazz drummer Andrew Neiman, who is pushed to his limit by his abusive and ruthless instructor.

title: Interstellar
description: 2014 epic science fiction film. Set in a dystopian future where humanity is struggling to survive, the film follows a group of astronauts who travel through a wormhole near Saturn in search of a new home for mankind.

title: The Godfather
description: Trilogy of American crime films. The films follow the trials of the fictional Italian American mafia Corleone family whose patriarch, Vito Corleone, rises to be a major figure in American organized crime.

title: Alien
description: 1979 science fiction horror film. It follows the crew of the commercial space tug Nostromo, who, after coming across a mysterious derelict spaceship on an undiscovered moon, find themselves up against an aggressive and deadly extraterrestrial set loose on the Nostromo.

title: Up
description: 2009 American computer-animated film. The film centers on elderly widower Carl Fredricksen and Wilderness Explorer Russell, who go on a journey to South America in order to fulfill a promise that Carl made to his late wife Ellie.

title: The Sound of Music
description: 1965 American musical drama film. The film is about a young Austrian postulant in Salzburg, Austria, in 1938 who is sent to the villa of a retired naval officer and widower to be governess to his seven children.

title: Seven
description: 1995 American neo-noir psychological crime thriller film. The film tells the story of David Mills, a detective who partners with the retiring William Somerset to track down a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as a motif in his murders.

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
description: 1968 epic science fiction film. It explores themes such as human evolution, technology, artificial intelligence, and the possibility of extraterrestrial life.

title: Vertigo
description: 1958 American film noir psychological thriller film. It follows James Stewart as former police detective John
Ferguson, who has retired because an incident in the line of duty has caused him to develop acrophobia and vertigo.

title: Gone with the Wind
description: 1939 American epic historical romance film. Set in the American South against the backdrop of the American Civil War and the Reconstruction era, the film tells the story of Scarlett O'Hara, the strong-willed daughter of a Georgia plantation owner, following her romantic pursuit of Ashley Wilkes, who is married to his cousin, Melanie Hamilton, and her subsequent marriage to Rhett Butler.

title: Monty Python
description: British surreal comedy troupe who created the sketch comedy television show Monty Python's Flying Circus. The Pythons' influence on comedy has been compared to the Beatles' influence on music.

title: Lost
description: American drama television series. The show contains elements of supernatural and science fiction, and follows the survivors of a commercial jet airliner flying between Sydney and Los Angeles, after the plane crashes on a mysterious island somewhere in the South Pacific Ocean.

title: House of Cards
description: American political thriller streaming television series, and is the story of Frank Underwood, an amoral politician and Democrat from South Carolina's 5th congressional district, and his equally ambitious wife Claire Underwood.

title: The L Word
description: American series that follows the lives of a group of lesbian and bisexual women who live in West Hollywood, California.

title: Queer as Folk
description: British and subsequently American serial drama television series, which follow the lives of gay men.

title: Sherlock Holmes
description: Fictional detective created by Scottish author Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.

title: Marilyn Monroe
description: American actress, singer, and model. Famous for playing comedic
characters, she became one of the most popular sex symbols of the 1950s.

title: Elvis Presley
description: American singer and actor. Dubbed the
, he is regarded as one of the most significant cultural icons of the 20th century.

title: Beyoncé
description: American singer, songwriter, and actress, highly reagarded as one of the most important icons in pop culture's history.

title: Dracula
description: Title character of Bram Stoker's 1897 gothic horror novel Dracula.

title: Indiana Jones
description: Fictional professor of archaeology, main character in the American media franchise based on the adventures of Dr. Henry Walton
Jones, Jr.

title: Neymar
description: Brazilian professional footballer. A prolific goalscorer and renowned playmaker, he is regarded as one of the best players in the world.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo
description: Portuguese professional footballer. Often considered the best player in the world and widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time.

title: Batman
description: Superhero appearing in American comic books published by DC Comics.

title: Adele
description: English singer and songwriter. She is one of the world's best-selling music artists, with sales of over 120 million records.

title: Lindsay Lohan
description: American actress, singer, songwriter, producer, and entrepreneur. During the late 2000s, she became a fixture in the tabloid press for her legal issues, court appearances and a number of stints in rehabilitation facilities due to alcoholism.

title: Minions
description: Fictional characters, Minions are small, yellow creatures who have existed since the beginning of time, evolving from yellow single-celled organisms into beings which exist only to serve history's most evil masters.

title: Capitain Jack Sparrow
description: Fictional character and the main protagonist of the Pirates of the Caribbean film series.

title: Joker
description: Supervillain appearing in American comic books published by DC Comics.

title: Gollum (Sméagol)
description: Fictional monster in J. R. R. Tolkien's Middle-earth legendarium. He was introduced in the 1937 fantasy novel The Hobbit, and became important in its sequel, The Lord of the Rings.

title: Darth Vader
description: Fictional character in the Star Wars franchise. The character is the primary antagonist in the original trilogy and, as Anakin Skywalker, is one of the primary protagonists throughout the prequel trilogy.

title: James Bond
description: Fictional British Secret Service agent created in 1953 by writer Ian Fleming.

title: Wolverine
description: Fictional character appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics, mostly in association with the X-Men.

title: Kim Kardashian
description: American socialite, model, media personality and businesswoman. She first gained media attention as a friend and stylist of Paris Hilton, but received wider notice after her sex tape was released in 2007 and the subsequent release of the reality television series Keeping Up with the Kardashians.

title: Snoop Dogg
description: American rapper, songwriter, media personality, actor, and entrepreneur.

title: Freddie Mercury
description: British singer and songwriter, who achieved worldwide fame as the lead vocalist of the rock band Queen.

title: Justin Bieber
description: Canadian singer, widely recognised for his genre-melding musicianship and has played an influential role in modern-day popular music.

title: Tyler Durden
description: Fictional character and the primary antagonist appearing as the central figure of the 1996 Chuck Palahniuk novel Fight Club, its 1999 film adaptation of the same name.

title: Hannibal Lecter
description: Fictional forensic psychiatrist character created by novelist Thomas Harris. Lecter is a serial killer who eats his victims.

title: Norman Bates
description: Fictional character created by American author Robert Bloch as the main antagonist in his 1959 thriller novel Psycho.

title: Frankenstein (Monster)
description: English fictional monster character who first appeared in Mary Shelley's 1818 novel Frankenstein.

title: Bugs Bunny
description: Animated bunny cartoon character created in the late 1930s by Leon Schlesinger Productions (later Warner Bros. Cartoons).

title: Peter Pan
description: Fictional character created by Scottish novelist and playwright J. M. Barrie. A free-spirited and mischievous young boy who can fly and never grows up.

title: Neo
description: Fictional character and the protagonist of The Matrix franchise, created by the Wachowskis.

title: Katniss Everdeen
description: Fictional character and the protagonist of The Hunger Games trilogy written by American author Suzanne Collins.

title: Bane
description: Supervillain appearing in American comic books published by DC Comics.

title: Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson
description: American actor, businessman, and former professional wrestler. He wrestled for WWE for eight years prior to pursuing an acting career.

title: Imperator Furiosa
description: Fictional character in the 2015 film Mad Max: Fury Road. She is a war captain under Immortan Joe but turns against him in order to free
, Joe's female concubines (or

title: Hans Landa
description: Fictional character and the main antagonist in the 2009 Quentin Tarantino film Inglourious Basterds. He is portrayed by Austrian actor Christoph Waltz.

title: Edna Mode
description: Fictional character in Pixar's animated superhero film The Incredibles and its sequel Incredibles 2. She is an eccentric fashion designer renowned for designing the costumes of several famous superheroes.

title: Optimus Prime
description: Fictional character created by the Transformers franchise. He is a Cybertronian, a fictional extraterrestrial species of sentient self-configuring modular robotic lifeforms.

title: Wednesday Addams
description: Fictional character created by American cartoonist Charles Addams, as the daughter in the Addams Family's franchises.

title: V
description: Title character of the comic book series V for Vendetta. He is a mysterious anarchist, vigilante, and freedom fighter who is easily recognizable by his Guy Fawkes mask, long hair and dark clothing.

title: Donnie Darko
description: Main fictional character in the American science fiction psychological thriller film Donnie Darko.

title: E.T.
description: Main fictional character in the American science fiction film produced and directed by Steven Spielberg.

title: George Washington
description: American military officer, statesman, and Founding Father who served as the 1st president of the United States from 1789 to 1797.

title: Napoleon Bonaparte
description: French military and political leader who rose to prominence during the French Revolution and led several successful campaigns during the Revolutionary Wars.

title: Albert Einstein
description: German-born theoretical physicist,[7] widely acknowledged to be one of the greatest and most influential physicists of all time.

title: Adolf Hitler
description: Austrian-born German politician who was the dictator of Germany from 1933 until his death in 1945. He was closely involved in military operations throughout the war and was central to the perpetration of the Holocaust, the genocide of about six million Jews and millions of other victims.

title: Jesus
description: The central figure of Christianity, the world's largest religion. Most Christians believe he is the incarnation of God the Son and the awaited messiah (the Christ), prophesied in the Hebrew Bible.

title: Sigmund Freud
description: Austrian neurologist and the founder of psychoanalysis, a clinical method for evaluating and treating pathologies in the psyche through dialogue between a patient and a psychoanalyst.

title: Charles Robert Darwin
description: English naturalist, geologist and biologist, best known for his contributions to evolutionary biology. His proposition that all species of life have descended from common ancestors is now widely accepted and considered a fundamental concept in science.

title: Che Guevara
description: Argentine Marxist revolutionary, physician, writer, guerrilla leader, diplomat, and military theorist. A major figure of the Cuban Revolution, his stylized visage has become a ubiquitous countercultural symbol of rebellion.

title: Cleopatra
description: Former Queen of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt from 51 to 30 BC, and its last active ruler.

title: Christopher Columbus
description: Italian explorer and navigator who completed four voyages across the Atlantic Ocean, opening the way for the widespread European exploration and colonization of the Americas.

title: Joseph Stalin
description: Georgian revolutionary and Soviet political leader who ruled the Soviet Union from 1922 until his death in 1953.

title: Benito Amilcare Andrea Mussolini
description: Italian politician and journalist who founded and led the National Fascist Party. He was Prime Minister of Italy from the March on Rome in 1922 until his deposition in 1943.

title: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
description: Prolific and influential composer of the Classical period, universally regarded among the greatest composers in the history of Western music.

title: Friedrich Nietzsche
description: German philosopher, cultural critic and philologist whose work has exerted a profound influence on modern intellectual history.

title: Gautama Buddha
description: Ascetic and spiritual teacher of Nepal and South Asia who lived during the latter half of the first millennium BCE.[30][31][14][note 6] He was the founder of Buddhism and is revered by Buddhists as an awakened being.

title: Gengis Khan
description: Founder and first Great Khan (Emperor) of the Mongol Empire, which became the largest contiguous empire in history after his death.

title: Leonardo Da Vinci
description: Italian polymath of the High Renaissance who was active as a painter, draughtsman, engineer, scientist, theorist, sculptor, and architect. His magnum opus, the Mona Lisa, is his best known work and often regarded as the world's most famous painting.

title: Ludwig van Beethoven
description: German composer and pianist, one of the most admired composers in the history of Western music.

title: Plato
description: Greek philosopher born in Athens during the Classical period in Ancient Greece, widely considered a pivotal figure in the history of Ancient Greek and Western philosophy, along with his teacher, Socrates, and his most famous student, Aristotle.

title: Aristotle
description: Greek philosopher and polymath during the Classical period in Ancient Greece. Taught by Plato, he was the founder of the Lyceum, the Peripatetic school of philosophy, and the Aristotelian tradition.

title: Abraham Lincoln
description: American lawyer and statesman who served as the 16th president of the United States and led the nation through the American Civil War and succeeded in preserving the Union, abolishing slavery, bolstering the federal government, and modernizing the U.S. economy.

title: Mahatma Gandhi
description: Indian lawyer, anti-colonial nationalist and political ethicist who employed nonviolent resistance to lead the successful campaign for India's independence from British rule.

title: Thomas Alva Edison
description: American inventor and businessman. He developed many devices in fields such as electric power generation, mass communication, sound recording, and motion pictures. These inventions, which include the phonograph, the motion picture camera, and early versions of the electric light bulb.

title: Johann Sebastian Bach
description: German composer and musician of the late Baroque period, generally regarded as one of the greatest composers in the history of Western music.

title: Julius Caesar
description: Roman general and statesman, who led the Roman armies in the Gallic Wars before defeating his political rival Pompey in a civil war, and subsequently became dictator of Rome from 49 BC until his assassination in 44 BC. He played a critical role in the events that led to the demise of the Roman Republic and the rise of the Roman Empire.

title: Alexander the Great
description: King of the ancient Greek kingdom of Macedon. Beginning shortly after his father's death, he spent most of his ruling years conducting a lengthy military campaign throughout Western Asia and Egypt, Central Asia, and South Asia. By the age of 30, he had created one of the largest empires in history.

title: Nikola Tesla
description: Serbian-American inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, and futurist best known for his contributions to the design of the modern alternating current (AC) electricity supply system.

title: Joan of Arc
description: Considered a heroine of France for her role in the siege of Orléans and the coronation of Charles VII of France during the Hundred Years' War against England.

title: Vladimir Ilyich Ulianov (Lenin)
description: Russian revolutionary, politician, and political theorist. He served as the first and founding head of government of Soviet Russia from 1917 to 1924 and of the Soviet Union from 1922 to 1924.

title: Adam Smith
description: Scottish economist and philosopher who was a pioneer of political economy and key figure during the Scottish Enlightenment.

title: Isaac Newton
description: English mathematician, physicist, astronomer, alchemist, theologian and author, widely recognised as one of the greatest mathematicians and physicists of all time.

title: Karl Heinrich Marx
description: German philosopher, critic of political economy, economist, historian, sociologist, political theorist, journalist and socialist revolutionary. His best-known titles are the 1848 pamphlet The Communist Manifesto and the three-volume Das Kapital.

title: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky
description: Russian composer of the Romantic period. He wrote some of the most popular concert and theatrical music in the current classical repertoire, including the ballets Swan Lake and The Nutcracker.

title: Nicolaus Copernicus
description: Renaissance polymath, active as a mathematician, astronomer, and Catholic canon, who formulated a model of the universe that placed the Sun rather than Earth at its center.

title: Lucy
description: Worldwide famous fossil. The Lucy specimen is collection of several hundred pieces of fossilized bone representing 40 percent of an early female australopithecine and is dated to about 3.2 million years ago.

title: Winston Churchill
description: British statesman, soldier and writer who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1940 to 1945, during the Second World War.

title: Marie Curie
description: Polish and naturalized-French physicist and chemist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize.

title: Margaret Thatcher
description: First female prime minister of the UK. She implemented policies that became known as Thatcherism. A Soviet journalist dubbed her the
, a nickname that became associated with her uncompromising politics and leadership style.

title: Rosa Parks
description: American activist in the civil rights movement, best known for her pivotal role in the Montgomery bus boycott, where she rejected bus driver James F. Blake's order to vacate a row of four seats in the
section in favor of a White passenger.

title: Marina Raskova
description: Russian aviator who petitioned Stalin to let her raise a regiment of female pilots. Stalin consented, forming the 588th Night Bomber Regiment, tasked with destroying German trenches, and which was nicknamed The Night Witches by their unexpected attacks at night.

title: France
description: Most visited country in the world. Has as its moto ‘Liberté, égalitié, fraternité’.

title: Canada
description: Despite being the 2º biggest country in the world, 90% of the population lives within 150 miles of the US border.

title: United States of America
description: Currently the richest country in the platet, its GDP corresponds to approximately USD 20 trillion, or about a quarter of the world's GDP.

title: Brazil
description: Brazil's northernmost point is closer to every country in the Americas than to Brazil's southernmost point (including Canada).

title: Germany
description: 65% of the highways in Germany have no speed limit in certain parts and are called the Autobahn.

title: Japan
description: If you include the greater Tokyo metro area of Kanagawa, Saitama, and Chiba, the total population of Tokyo reaches 38 million people, the largest in the world.

title: Argentina
description: Up to 25 million Argentines have some degree of Italian descent, around 60% of the total population.

title: Portugal
description: Portugal has had the same defined borders since 1139, making it the oldest nation-state in Europe.

title: Italy
description: The standard dialect of Italian is based on the Tuscan dialect. However, there are several regional dialects in Italian.

title: Mexico
description: Due to the fact that Mexico City has been built over a lake, the Mexican capital is currently sinking almost 20 inches a year, as the aquifer underneath the city is drained to supply the city's water needs.

title: Cuba
description: The USA armed forces use a defense readiness condition system ranging from
(no threat) a
(nuclear war). DEFCON-2 was activated only twice, the first during the Cuban Missile Crisis of 1962.

title: Jamaica
description: Queen Elizabeth II is not only the monarch of the U.K., but also of 14 other countries, including Jamaica.

title: Venezuela
description: The country holds the largest crude oil reserves in the world, amounting to more than 300 billion barrels.

title: Colombia
description: Colombia is the second most biodiverse country in the world, after only Brazil which is 10 times its size.

title: Ukraine
description: The world's worst nuclear accident took place in Ukraine on April 26, 1986, at the Chernobyl nuclear power station.

title: India
description: The Taj Mahal is not a palace, but rather a tomb, and was built in the 17th century by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan to honor his third wife, Mumtaz Mahal, who died in childbirth.

title: China
description: China has around 1.4 billion people, with 1 in 5 people in the world being Chinese.

title: Greece
description: The entire famous island of Santorini is actually a volcanic rock. In the last 400.000 years, the Santorini volcano has erupted over 100 times.

title: United Arab Emirates
description: The UAE is comprised of seven different emirates: Abu Dhabi, Dubai, Sharjah, Ras al-Khaimah, Ajman, Umm al-Quwain and Fujairah. Each emirate has different cultures and traditions.

title: United Kingdom
description: The United Kingdom (UK) is made up of England, Scotland, Wales (these three forming what's called Great Britain in the bigger island) and Northern Ireland.

title: Australia
description: Australia has the world's largest herd of wild camels and lakhs of them roam in the wild, all brought by the British India and Afghanistan during the 19th century for transport and construction during the colonisation.

title: Spain
description: There are five official languages in Spain: Castilian, Catalan, Galician, Basque and Aranese (which has only 2,800 native speakers).

title: Finland
description: Rovaniemi was declared as the Official Hometown of Santa Claus and the provincial capital of Lapland, in northern Finland.

title: Poland
description: Polish TV is dubbed by one person, in voiceover style, with the original track in the back.

title: Sweden
description: At summer’s peak, the northernmost region of Sweden experiences a phenomenon known as the midnight sun, where the sun never sets – creating a unique, 24 hours of daylight.

title: Norway
description: Although perhaps counterintuitive, Norway and Russia share a 196-kilometre land border in the Arctic Circle, in an area referred to as the “High North”.

title: Thailand
description: You must be thinking that Bangkok is definitely not the longest city name however, look at the traditional Thai name – “Krung Thep Mahanakhon Amon Rattanakosin Mahinthara Yuthaya Mahadilok Phop Noppharat Ratchathani Burirom Udomratchaniwet Mahasathan Amon Piman Awatan Sathit Sakkathattiya Witsanukam Prasit.”

title: Indonesia
description: Java Island is the world's most populous island with an estimated population of 143.1 million people, similar to Russia's.

title: Nepal
description: Nepal is home to the highest mountain in the world. Mount Everest is 8,848m (29,029ft) high.

title: Romania
description: Romania is, of course, the home of Vlad the Impaler, a.k.a the inspiration for the Dracula character, and visitors can visit Bran Castle which was where Bram Stoker based his story.

title: Saudi Arabia
description: Most of the country's territory is a desert, with no permanent rivers or lakes and very little rainfall.

title: Turkey
description: Turkey has the EU’s largest young population. The average age in Turkey is around 31, and only 9% of the country’s population is over 60.

title: Mauritania
description: In 1981, Mauritania made slavery illegal, the last country in the world to do so.

title: Turkmenistan
description: In the hot, expansive Karakum desert in Turkmenistan, near the 350-person village of Darvaza, is a hole 230 feet wide that has been on fire for over 50 years. Though technically called the Darvaza gas crater, locals know the crater as “The Gates of Hell.”.

title: Bosnia and Herzegovina
description: The United Nations Mine Action Centre (UNMAC) estimates that there are at present over 30,000 mined areas in Bosnia and Herzegovina, a huge problem for the country.

title: Cambodia
description: Angkor Wat is the largest religious monument on the planet. Angkor Wat is spread across over 400 acres / 1.6 km², and is said to be the largest religious monument in the world.

title: Papua New Guinea
description: More than 850 languages are used within the 462,840 km2 that make up the country of Papua New Guinea. This makes it the most linguistically diverse country on the planet.

title: Burundi
description: The Nile river begins in the central part of Africa in Burundi.

title: Belize
description: The Belize Barrier Reef is just second of its kind on the planet, after Australia.

title: Moldova
description: Transnistria, a sliver of land that snakes around the Ukrainian border,  declared independence from Moldova in 1990. The United Nations doesn’t recognise the country, but the breakaway state does have its own currency and border controls.

title: Red Solo Cups
description: A must have for every party.

title: Hippopotamus
description: Large semiaquatic mammal native to sub-Saharan Africa.

title: Giant Panda
description: Bear species endemic to China, characterised by its bold black-and-white coat and rotund body.

title: Kangaroo
description: Marsupial animal indigenous to Australia.

title: Netflix
description: There's a good chance you've seen the pig scene.

title: Covid-19
description: When you find out your normal daily lifestyle is called

title: Great Wall of China
description: Series of fortifications that were built across the historical northern borders of ancient Chinese states and Imperial China as protection against various nomadic groups from the Eurasian Steppe.

title: Nokia
description: The covers you may have used were to protect the floor.

title: Bitcoin
description: Everything you don't know about money, combined with everything you don't know about computers.

title: Christ the Redeemer
description: Brazil's cultural icon and biggest landmark, it's an Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, created by French sculptor Paul Landowski.

title: Audioslave
description: American rock group. The four-piece band consisted of Soundgarden's lead singer and rhythm guitarist Chris Cornell with Rage Against the Machine members.

title: Balenciaga
description: Spanish luxury fashion house founded in 1919 by the Spanish designer Cristóbal Balenciaga in San Sebastian, Spain and bought afterwards by French luxury group Kering.

title: Avoiding the Lines on the Sidewalk
description: When you walk along the sidewalk, do you try to avoid the lines? Some people do that.

title: Reciting the Alphabet
description: Reciting the entire alphabet to remember where one letter is.

title: Listening to sad music when you're sad
description: Listening to sad music when you are feeling sad, so you get sadder.

title: Mistakenly Waving at Someone
description: Who hasn't mistakenly waved at someone who was actually waving at the person behind you? We've all been there!

title: Edward Snowden
description: American former computer intelligence consultant who leaked highly classified information from the National Security Agency (NSA) in 2013. His disclosures revealed numerous global surveillance programs, which prompted a cultural discussion about national security and individual privacy.

title: Fable
description: Succinct fictional story, in prose or verse, that features animals, legendary creatures, plants, inanimate objects, or forces of nature that are anthropomorphized, and that illustrates or leads to a particular moral lesson.

title: Currency
description: Standardization of money in any form when in use or circulation as a medium of exchange, for example banknotes and coins.

title: Bathroom stall door gap
description: (especially in the USA) it's the bottom gap underneath bathroom stalls, called
. A huge gap is not absolutely necessary, but if there is no big gap, the toilet stall has to be wider.

title: BTS
description: South Korean band, also known as the Bangtan Boys.

title: Judas Priest
description: English heavy metal band formed in Birmingham in 1969.

title: Platypus
description: Semiaquatic, egg-laying mammal endemic to eastern Australia.

title: Tom Hardy
description: English actor, producer, screenwriter and former model. He has appeared in films such as Inception (2010), The Dark Knight Rises (2012) as Bane and in Mad Max: Fury Road (2015) as Max.

title: Bigfoot (Sasquatch)
description: Purported ape-like creature said to inhabit the forests of North America.

title: Tamagotchi
description: Handheld digital pet that was created in Japan, housed in a small egg-shaped handheld video game with an interface consisting of three buttons.

title: Guitar Hero
description: Series of music rhythm game video games first released in 2005, in which players use a guitar-shaped game controller to simulate playing primarily lead, bass guitar, and rhythm guitar across numerous songs.

title: Paralympics
description: Periodic series of international multi-sport events involving athletes with a range of physical disabilities.

title: Artichoke
description: Variety of a species of thistle cultivated as a food.

title: Jester
description: Member of the household of a nobleman or a monarch employed to entertain guests during the medieval and Renaissance eras.

title: Blizzard
description: Severe snowstorm characterized by strong sustained winds and low visibility, lasting for a prolonged period of time—typically at least three or four hours.

title: Typhoon
description: Mature tropical cyclone that develops between 180° and 100°E in the Northern Hemisphere, region referred to as the Northwestern Pacific Basin.

title: Cthulhu
description: Fictional cosmic entity created by writer H. P. Lovecraft. It was first introduced in his short story
, published by the American pulp magazine Weird Tales in 1928.

title: NFT
description: A non-fungible token (NFT) is a financial security consisting of digital data stored in a blockchain, a form of distributed ledger. The ownership of an NFT is recorded in the blockchain, and can be transferred by the owner, allowing NFTs to be sold and traded. Got it? Me neither!

title: Moby-Dick
description: 1851 novel by American writer Herman Melville. The book is the sailor Ishmael's narrative of the obsessive quest of Ahab, captain of the whaling ship Pequod, for revenge against Moby Dick, the giant white sperm whale that on the ship's previous voyage bit off Ahab's leg at the knee.

title: Carmen
description: Opera in four acts by the French composer Georges Bizet.

title: Revolution
description: The movement of the earth around the sun in its orbit.

title: Shinto
description: Shinto (literally “the way of the gods”) is Japan's native belief system and predates historical records, being as old as Japan itself.

title: Romulus and Remus
description: Tale of the mythical twin brothers raised by a she-wolf, whose story tells of the events that led to the founding of the city of Rome and the Roman Kingdom by Romulus, following his killing of Remus.

title: Sternocleidomastoid
description: One of the largest and most superficial cervical muscles. The primary actions of the muscle are rotation of the head to the opposite side and flexion of the neck.
